Seemingly more of a locals spot due to its location away from the tourist area but travelers can still be found here.  It's worth the journey if you're walking, the food is very good and very reasonably priced.  We ordered the patatas bravas and the paella (which requires a minimum of two people to order).  We wanted to order more but our waiter stopped us, mentioning that what we ordered would be enough.  The patatas bravas were simple but good and something good to temporarily quiet our grumbling stomachs.  The paella was excellent!  I haven't had paella too many times in my life but I'd have to say that this was the best one thus far.  It seriously looked and tasted perfect.  The rest of our stay we saw people eating paella at restaurants all over Barcelona and especially on Las Ramblas, but none looked nearly as appetizing.  For dessert we went with the Catalan crema, a local dessert not unlike creme brulee.  Wine here is also an awesome deal.  For a full bottle of house red, white or rose wine its only 3€50!
